title: Energy Action Full Year 2025 Earnings: EPS: AU$0.052 (vs AU$0.019 in FY 2024)
description: Energy Action ( ASX:EAX ) Full Year 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: AU$12.8m (up 19% from FY 2024). Net...
content:
• Profit margin: 16% (up from 5.4% in FY 2024). The increase in margin was driven by higher revenue.
• EPS: AU$0.052 (up from AU$0.019 in FY 2024).

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Energy Action shares are up 3.9% from a week ago.

Before we wrap up, we've discovered 3 warning signs for Energy Action (1 can't be ignored!) that you should be aware of.

We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: The article discusses the potential benefits of President Donald Trump's proposed policies on American oil and gas. Energy Action shares are up 3.9% from a week ago. The company's full-year earnings are set at AU$0.052, up from AU$ 0.09 in FY 2024, and its profit margin is 16%, driven by increased revenue. The article also mentions three warning signs for investors.
shortSummary: Energy Action's earnings report shows significant increases in profit margins driven by higher revenue, but warns of potential price increases and potential market instability.

Results
22
Midstream oil and gas companies, specifically pipeline operators, are well-positioned to benefit from Trump’s executive orders on fossil fuels enacted in early 2025. – – These policies aim to accelerate infrastructure development by streamlining environmental reviews and permitting processes, such as those under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The declaration of a "national energy emergency" further empowers these companies by prioritizing pipeline and storage projects to support increased production from newly accessible federal lands and waters. – – The push to "unleash American energy" also amplifies demand for midstream services as upstream production ramps up, particularly in regions like Alaska and offshore areas reopened for drilling. Pipelines and storage facilities will be critical to moving larger volumes of oil and gas efficiently, especially with the renewed emphasis on LNG exports to meet global demand.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 2000 | n/a | Derek Myers | energyaction.com.au |
Energy Action Limited, an independent energy partner, provides electricity and gas procurement services, energy management, and retail billing services to business customers in Australia. It offers energy procurement services, including broking or consulting using a range of procurement methodologies comprising auctions, tenders, progressive and structured purchasing, corporate power purchase agreements; and energy management services, consisting of managed client energy contracts and environmental reporting that includes account management, liaison with retailers, bill and tariff validation, and helps understand the energy and emissions profile. The company also provides sourcing and contracting for solar solutions.

argos_summary: Energy Action Limited (ASX:EAX) reported a 16% net profit margin and EPS of AU$0.052, up from 5.4% margin and AU$0.019 EPS in FY 2024, driven by higher revenue and strong earnings growth (55% annualized). The company’s ROE stands at 45%, but revenue has declined 10.8% annually. Meanwhile, U.S. policy under President Trump is expected to benefit midstream oil and gas firms, potentially increasing demand for Energy Action’s services as pipeline and storage projects accelerate.
